  16. (* Definition of environments, used to pass parameters to tests and actions *)

  18. open Ocamltest_stdlib

  20. module VariableMap = Map.Make (Variables)

  22. ‌type t = string option VariableMap.t

  24. ‌let empty = VariableMap.empty

  26. ‌let to_bindings env =
  27.   let f variable value lst =
  28.     Option.fold ~none:lst ~some:(fun value -> (variable, value) :: lst) value
  29.   in
  30.   VariableMap.fold f env []

  32. ‌let expand_aux env value =
  33.   let bindings = to_bindings env in
  34.   let f (variable, value) = ((Variables.name_of_variable variable), value) in
  35. ‌  let simple_bindings = List.map f bindings in
  36. ‌  let subst s = try (List.assoc s simple_bindings) with Not_found -> "" in
  37. ‌  let b = Buffer.create 100 in
  38.   try Buffer.add_substitute b subst value; Buffer.contents b with _ -> value

  40. let rec expand env value =
  41. ‌  let expanded = expand_aux env value in
  42.   if expanded=value then value else expand env expanded

  44. ‌let expand env = function
  45.   | None -> raise Not_found
  46.   | Some value -> expand env value

  48. let append_to_system_env environment env =
  49.   (* Augment env with any bindings which are only in environment. This must be
  50.      done here as the Windows C implementation doesn't process multiple values
  51.      in settings.envp. *)
  52. ‌  let env =
  53.     let update env binding =
  54.       let name, value =
  55.         match String.index binding '=' with
  56.         | c ->
  57.             let name = String.sub binding 0 c in
  58.             let value =
  59.               String.sub binding (c + 1) (String.length binding - c - 1) in
  60.             (name, Some value)
  61.         | exception Not_found ->
  62.             (binding, None)
  63.       in
  64. ‌      let var = Variables.make (name, "system env var") in
  65.         if not (VariableMap.mem var env) then
  66. ‌          VariableMap.add var value env
  67.         else
  68.           env
  69.     in
  70.       Array.fold_left update env environment
  71.   in
  72.   let system_env = Array.make (VariableMap.cardinal env) "" in
  73. ‌  let i = ref 0 in
  74. ‌  let store variable value =
  75.     let some value =
  76.       Variables.string_of_binding variable (expand env (Some value)) in
  77.     system_env.(!i) <-
  78.       Option.fold ~none:(Variables.name_of_variable variable) ~some value;
  79.     incr i in
  80.   VariableMap.iter store env;
  81.   system_env

  83. ‌let to_system_env env =
  84.   append_to_system_env [||] env

  86. ‌let lookup variable env =
  87.   try Some (expand env (VariableMap.find variable env)) with Not_found -> None

  89. ‌let lookup_nonempty variable env = match lookup variable env with
  90.   | None -> None
  91.   | Some x as t -> if String.words x = [] then None else t

  93. ‌let lookup_as_bool variable env =
  94.   match lookup variable env with
  95.   | None -> None
  96.   | Some "true" -> Some true
  97.   | Some _ -> Some false

  99. ‌let lookup_as_int variable env =
  100.   match lookup variable env with
  101.   | None -> None
  102.   | Some value ->
  103.       int_of_string_opt value

  105. let safe_lookup variable env = match lookup variable env with
  106.   | None -> ""
  107.   | Some value -> value

  109. let is_variable_defined variable env =
  110.   VariableMap.mem variable env

  112. ‌let add variable value env = VariableMap.add variable (Some value) env

  114. ‌let add_if_undefined variable value env =
  115. ‌  if VariableMap.mem variable env then env else add variable value env

  117. let append variable appened_value environment =
  118.   let previous_value = safe_lookup variable environment in
  119.   let new_value = previous_value ^ appened_value in
  120.   VariableMap.add variable (Some new_value) environment

  122. ‌let remove = VariableMap.remove

  124. ‌let unsetenv variable environment =
  125.   VariableMap.add variable None environment

  127. ‌let add_bindings bindings env =
  128. ‌  let f env (variable, value) = add variable value env in
  129.   List.fold_left f env bindings

  131. let from_bindings bindings = add_bindings bindings empty

  133. ‌let dump_assignment log = function
  134.   | (variable, Some value) ->
  135.     Printf.fprintf log "%s = %s\n%!" (Variables.name_of_variable variable) value
  136.   | (variable, None) ->
  137.     Printf.fprintf log "unsetenv %s\n%!" (Variables.name_of_variable variable)

  139. ‌let dump log environment =
  140.   List.iter (dump_assignment log) (VariableMap.bindings environment)

  142. (* Initializers *)

  144. ‌type kind = Pre | Post

  146. ‌type env_initializer = out_channel -> t -> t

  148. ‌type initializers =
  149.   {
  150.     pre: (string, env_initializer) Hashtbl.t;
  151.     post: (string, env_initializer) Hashtbl.t;
  152.   }

  154. ‌let initializers = {pre = Hashtbl.create 10; post = Hashtbl.create 10}

  156. ‌let get_initializers = function
  157.   | Pre -> initializers.pre
  158.   | Post -> initializers.post

  160. ‌let register_initializer kind name code =
  161.   Hashtbl.add (get_initializers kind) name code

  163. ‌let apply_initializer _log _name code env =
  164.   code _log env

  166. ‌let initialize kind log env =
  167.   let f = apply_initializer log in
  168.   Hashtbl.fold f (get_initializers kind) env

  170. (* Modifiers *)

  172. ‌type modifier =
  173.   | Include of string
  174.   | Add of Variables.t * string
  175.   | Append of Variables.t * string
  176.   | Remove of Variables.t

  178. ‌type modifiers = modifier list

  180. exception Empty_modifiers_name
  181. exception Modifiers_name_already_registered of string
  182. exception Modifiers_name_not_found of string

  184. ‌let (registered_modifiers : (string, modifiers) Hashtbl.t) = Hashtbl.create 20

  186. ‌let register_modifiers name modifiers =
  187.   if name="" then raise Empty_modifiers_name
  188.   else if Hashtbl.mem registered_modifiers name
  189.   then raise (Modifiers_name_already_registered name)
  190.   else Hashtbl.add registered_modifiers name modifiers

  192. ‌let find_modifiers name =
  193.   try Hashtbl.find registered_modifiers name
  194.   with Not_found -> raise (Modifiers_name_not_found name)

  196. ‌let rec apply_modifier environment = function
  197.   | Include modifiers_name ->
  198.     apply_modifiers environment (find_modifiers modifiers_name)
  199. ‌  | Add (variable, value) -> add variable value environment
  200.   | Append (variable, value) -> append variable value environment
  201.   | Remove variable -> remove variable environment
  202. and apply_modifiers environment modifiers =
  203.   List.fold_left apply_modifier environment modifiers
